title: Little Mouse
author: Little Mouse
content: This thread is created as a reference for a neutral tag. Self-moderated to prevent some of the trolls. I don't have the intention to delete on topic post.Both users used the same Bitcoin address- bc1qpuv2awuxcan2jzv8r9zdc9f48dsymyw2q4xrdnUser Jocuserious used the address here:Quote from: Jocuserious on September 20, 2023, 03:16:59 AMMerit earned in the last 120 days: 5BTC Segwit addy: bc1qpuv2awuxcan2jzv8r9zdc9f48dsymyw2q4xrdnUser Dessy88 used the address here:Quote from: Dessy88 on July 19, 2023, 12:25:48 PMBitcointalk Rank: Full member Lifetime earned merit: 100Bech32 address: bc1qpuv2awuxcan2jzv8r9zdc9f48dsymyw2q4xrdnI'm tagging them as neutral and using this thread as a reference. If you/someone have more proofs, feel free to post them here.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: Both Jocuserious and Dessy88 were participated in a same campaign ðŸ”´[BOUNTY]KIttieFight 100K KTY Tokens Up for GrabsðŸ”´https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1sFatg2tDak_vInolFI8UxxD9hBsAbfrtGbLzA9WKFR8/edit#gid=1126782285The campaign have a rule to forbid cheating.Quote from: qs101 on September 30, 2020, 01:42:31 PMGENERAL BOUNTY RULESâ€¢ We reserve to eliminate any participants that we find cheating or being dishonest with his/her work.Both of them deleted their posts in this thread, fortunately their post are recorded by scrapers.Jocuserious's posts in KIttieFight bountyDessy88's posts in KIttieFight bountyNow they're not only receive neutral feedback due to alt connection, I'm going to tag them using negative feedback because they broke the campaign rule.

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on September 30, 2023, 06:27:05 AMIt looks like he has another account; the wallet address on the forum appeared earlier than Dessy88. True, the post itself looks very dubious; it is unclear in what condition the user applied for participation.No shohag is not alt of Dessy88. Actually he want to copy someone report but mistakenly copied whole thread page which can easily judge by his post as he posted many users weekly report data in own post.Both user mentioned by Little Mouse applied for Pepemo bounty manage by Julerz which is very strict to alts . I don't why Ninjastic space not showing any results for this address where as Its available in Bitcointalk yet.

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Quote from: lovesmayfamilis on September 30, 2023, 06:45:26 AMDid you take a good look at the dates of the posts? A month difference, does that tell you anything?Below image clearly show that All this is just copy mistake. He copied even merit, report to moderator, bounty title. he copied more than 7 users data

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.created_time: September 30, 2023, 02:48:22 PMLast edit: September 30, 2023, 02:58:29 PM by YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: Little Mouse on September 30, 2023, 05:15:14 AMI'm tagging them as neutral and using this thread as a reference. If you/someone have more proofs, feel free to post them here.Apart from the same BTC address used by both of them, of course there is other evidence that can be stated that they are both Alt, it can be seen from the reciprocal transactions they use using the Bep-20 address.For example: other visible evidence.Post by: Dessy88QuoteForum Username: Dessy88Telegram Username: @dessytopBep-20 Wallet (Binance smartchain) Address: 0x148ae4f6705C55DF2Cf42b967C98b7b4edBE7E29[ Archive ]Post by: JocuseriousQuoteForum Username: JocuseriousTelegram Username: @jocu360Bep-20 Wallet (Binance smartchain) Address: 0xcAe99d266Cc61412c3B07bF826C611b85aB722D5[ Archive ]1. https://bscscan.com/tx/0x57713bc780d0506e8d66c68db2115306d2ebab55d68fa0cc3895dc921151787b2. https://bscscan.com/tx/0x9dc63c2e6e75b7d43815690ab7cae572da20259dc8fb2f0e14af82ca29ed108bI have no doubt they are both the same Alt/person, @Little Mouse, since you are a manager, I think if they are trying to cheat in the campaign you manage, it seems worth making a reference.

comments.author: Shishir99
comments.body: Quote from: Little Mouse on September 30, 2023, 05:15:14 AMI'm tagging them as neutral and using this thread as a reference. If you/someone have more proofs, feel free to post them here.Now you have some more evidence that both accounts are handled by the same person. They used the same address, and they have a blockchain connection too. They cheated on some campaigns too. I saw the signature campaign spreadsheet where you asked the user to improve his post quality. I guess now it's time to change your mind and promote himÂ   Blockchain transaction alone cannot prove that account is handled by same person. But when they applied with the same BTC address, it cannot be just a transaction anymore.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Cheating in bounty and signature campaigns by using alt accounts:[BOUNTY] Vave - Crypto Casino and Betting Site | USDT Signature Campaignhttps://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Ax38ckXXWamhanhUJMhQoNam3kIYjNPppqtLUWyUupg/edit#gid=1273986599[BOUNTY] Pepemo | Meme, AI, Fun! Break the Matrix PepeMo! Both campaigns have a policy against alt accounts and both campaigns are managed by @julerz12.

comments.author: nutildah
comments.body: Additionally, this account seems to have changed hands between Dec 2017 and Apr 2018. The posting style of its owner went from educated crypto investor to total shitposter. They managed to last quite a while before being found out.Old owner:Quote from: Jocuserious on December 22, 2015, 08:29:49 PMYeah. Â Cryptsy is the problem, not SILK. There is an interesting theory on reddit that suggests that Vern lost a lot of BTC and is trying to get it back by creating arb situations with alts (that's why the prices are a bit different/higher over there). Â Pretty much, I would avoid trading there unless you want difficulty withdrawing. Â Limiting withdrawals allows them to retain the illusion of liquidity while they try to make it back. Â New owner:Quote from: Jocuserious on April 06, 2018, 07:01:05 PMDefinitely right now, Bitcoin will never scam.bitcoin is a real still king of currency.This theory is supported by BPIP:I'm not going hunting for more alts but am tagging this account and the previously connected alts.

comments.author: SmartGold01
comments.body: Quote from: Little Mouse on September 30, 2023, 05:15:14 AMI'm tagging them as neutral and using this thread as a reference. If you/someone have more proofs, feel free to post them here.The same address used in participating in a campaign already showed the prove and there is nothing to stress much about it, from the evidence provided by some few users he has been in found of using both accounts to participate in a same campaign which all the campaign prohibited that action.I am also gonna leave my feedback on that account and from my judgement redtag is what those accounts deserves. Nevertheless, from few post I have came across here said having Alt is not prohibited but using them to cheat in a particular campaign is highly prohibited or if one account is ban then the rest are not permitted to operate.
